content.description: Currently the only route on this small spire. Start by stemming next to thin seam for the first 25'. Then follow finger crack that protects very well. As crack dies, work out to arete, clip a bolt and pull over into trough. Easy face climbing to summit. Sling the long oblong summit for anchor. Needles style rappel.
content.location: Climbs the thin seam just right of North corner. At entrance of narrow corridor.

content.description:
Nestled up against Tricky Picket's NE corner is this smaller, hidden spire. Has narrow corridors on it's West and North sides.  

  At first I thought this may be the Conns' 'Picket Sign' spire, but it doesn't quite match the description. And the easiest looking route up this has very suspect rock (i backed off). So this may be a new summit in the Picket Fence!? Correct me if I'm wrong.
